subject: Cybersecurity
title: Zero Trust Architecture: Never Trust, Always Verify
description: A quick win: understand Zero Trust Architecture: Never Trust, Always Verify.

hook.text: The old model: trust everything inside the firewall. The new model: trust nothing, verify everything, every time.

buildup.text: Zero Trust assumes that attackers are already inside the network. Every access request must be authenticated.

discovery.text: Instead of a castle-and-moat approach, Zero Trust treats every user, device, and connection as potentially compromised.

twist.text: Google pioneered Zero Trust with BeyondCorp after being hacked by China in Operation Aurora. They rebuilt their.

climax.text: Zero Trust eliminates the concept of an internal 'safe zone.' Location no longer determines access â€” identity does.

punchline.text: Being inside the network means nothing. Prove who you are. Every time.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of Zero Trust architecture?
options: Never trust any connection by default, always verify identity and authorization
